intro: Medinilla erythrotricha, commonly known as the red-haired medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking red bracts that resemble hair, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that are clustered together in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and unique appearance. The leaves are typically glossy and dark green, adding to its aesthetic appeal in garden settings.
